titles.title: Waiving points of order against the conference report to accompany the bill (H.R. 775) to establish certain procedures for civil actions brought for damages relating to the failure of any device or system to process or otherwise deal with the transition from the year 1999 to the year 2000, and for other purposes.

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of the conference report to H.R. 775 with 1 hour of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Rule waives all points of order against the conference report and against its consideration.
The House Committee on Rules reported an original measure, H. Rept. 106-213, by Mr. Dreier.

calendar.text: Placed on the House Calendar, Calendar No. 80.

action.text: DEBATE - The House proceeded with one hour of debate on H. Res. 234.
The previous question was ordered without objection.

vote.text: On agreeing to the resolution Agreed to by the Yeas and Nays: 423 - 1 (Roll no. 263).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 6/30/1999--Introduced. Waives points of order against the consideration of the conference report on H.R. 775 (Year 2000 readiness and responsibility).
